parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From ek and histemi; to put out of wits, i.e. Astound, or become astounded, insane.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
